title: CropTool
loginform-blurb: CropTool is a tool for cropping images (JPG, PNG or GIF files) at Wikimedia sites. Learn more.
loginform-help: To use CropTool you need to connect it to your Wikimedia account. This process is secure and your password will not be given to CropTool.
titleform-help: Enter the URL or filename for an image you would like to crop.
titleform-footer: Tip: You can open CropTool directly from a media file. Learn more at Commons.
fetching-progress: Please wait while fetching image data and metadata... This might take some time depending on the image size...
cropform-select-region: Select a crop region by click-and-drag, or try the magic border locator.
cropform-method-precise-help: This method fully respects your selection, but as is usual with precise cropping, the process involves a small quality loss.
cropform-method-lossless-help: This method makes use of jpegtran, treating the image in terms of blocks (8×8 or 16×16 px depending on sampling). If the upper left part of the crop region does not fall on a block boundary, the crop region will have to be increased so that it does. The resulting image will therefore in general be a few pixels larger than requested, but never smaller than requested, and never more than 16 px larger.
previewform-lossless-explanation: The resulting image is {{wider}} px wider and {{higher}} px higher than the region you selected. Why? Note that the extra pixels included are in the left and/or top part of the image.
previewform-overwrite-policy: Before overwriting, make sure you are familiar with COM:CROP.
previewform-removed-border-help: Confirms removal of the 'remove border' template
results-success-details: View the result. Refreshing the page might be necessary.
